reviewText:
A Mass of Dead = A Mass Mistake, A Mass Failure, A Mass Catasrophe!

Ugh,  Just ugh.   Slow movement, absolute horrid zombie AI, Boring game, badly thought out controls, did I say pathetcally slow movement?

Watch my video if you must see it for youself, but save your money and save Steam the time of refunding your money!

reviewText:
SADLY, NOT WORTH YOUR TIME
I love horror video games. I love all kinds of them, from AAA titles all the way to tiny Indie releases. I even found some small enjoyment playing this game the first time, but upon playing it further, I've rapidly fallen out of love with this game. The worst part isn't that it does anything particularly wrong, it just fails to do much of anything right or original, and gave me no reason to keep coming back. Save your money on this one folks. If you don't believe me, watch my gameplay video and view it as the high-water mark of my experience with the game:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=485965593

Pros
None (I tried, sorry folks)
Cons
Bland environments
Terrible sound effects
No strategic challenge beyond simple keep away from monsters and shoot them"
Terrible Interface and Options Menu"

reviewText:
If you like wave based survival games you Might enjoy this. Sadly I found it very boring.

For 10 levels you get the exact same map over and over, finished off with a boss fight, and then you finally get a new map. For another 10 levels. The graphics make due, they're nothing special, and the audio is alright. Although the sub machine gun sounds like a pea shooter and flamethrower is so loud expect issues.

There is no urgency in the game, nothing makes you go OH NO" "I'm going to die
hoursPlayed: and just not fun.\n\nYou can upgrade and buy new weapons through gold coins

reviewText:
I recommend it!

It's a simple game. You're killing zombie hordes that come in waves in a top-down view. As you progress, the stages are more difficult and there is more variety in the horde of enemies.  There are three maps and each has 10 stages with different enemy makeup. Three stages have boss battles, and there are three challenge maps.

A mass of dead has three weapon types, with variants of each type (SMG, Shotgun, Flamethrower). All weapons are upgradeable with a basic upgrade system in place. There is also a variety of equipment upgrades that modify your character slightly, including health points, increased item drop, and increased run speed.

I wish there were more content in the game. More maps and enemy types would go a long way to make the game replayable. It's still pretty mindless fun. It's easy to get into and easy to pick up.
